summary.para: Gets the index of the matching font face reference in the font set, with the same file, face index, and simulations.

param.name: fontFace
param.para: Font face object that specifies the physical font.

param.name: listIndex
param.para: Receives the zero-based index of the matching font if the font was found, or UINT_MAX otherwise.

param.name: exists
param.para: Receives TRUE if the font exists or FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the index of the matching font face reference in the font set, with the same file, face index, and simulations.

param.name: fontFaceReference
param.para: Font face object that specifies the physical font.

param.name: listIndex
param.para: Receives the zero-based index of the matching font if the font was found, or UINT_MAX otherwise.

param.name: exists
param.para: Receives TRUE if the font exists or FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Get the number of total fonts in the set.

returns.para: Type: UINT32
Returns the number of total fonts in the set.

summary.para: Gets a reference to the font at the specified index, which may be local or remote.

param.name: fontFaceReference
param.para: Receives a pointer the font face reference object, or nullptr on failure.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Returns a subset of fonts filtered by the given properties.

param.name: properties
param.para: List of properties to filter using.

param.name: propertyCount
param.para: The number of properties to filter.

param.name: filteredSet
param.para: The subset of fonts that match the properties, or nullptr on failure.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If no fonts matched the filter, the subset will be empty (GetFontCount returns 0), but the function does not return an error. The subset will always be equal to or less than the original set. If you only want to filter out remote fonts, you may pass null in properties and zero in propertyCount.

summary.para: Returns a subset of fonts filtered by the given properties.

param.name: filteredSet
param.para: The subset of fonts that match the properties, or nullptr on failure.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If no fonts matched the filter, the subset will be empty (GetFontCount returns 0), but the function does not return an error. The subset will always be equal to or less than the original set. If you only want to filter out remote fonts, you may pass null in properties and zero in propertyCount.

summary.para: Returns how many times a given property value occurs in the set.

param.name: propertyOccurrenceCount
param.para: Receives how many times the property occurs.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Returns the property values of a specific font item index.

param.name: values
param.para: Receives a pointer to the newly created localized strings object, or nullptr on failure or non-existent property.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Returns all unique property values in the set, which can be used for purposes such as displaying a family list or tag cloud. Values are returned in priority order according to the language list, such that if a font contains more than one localized name, then the preferred one is returned.

param.name: preferredLocaleNames
param.para: The preferred locale names to query as a list of semicolon-delimited names in preferred order. When a particular string (such as font family) has more than one localized name, then the first match is returned. If the first match doesn't exist, then the second match is returned, and so on. For example, "ja-jp;en-us".

param.name: values
param.para: Receives a pointer to the newly created localized strings object; or nullptr on failure or non-existent property.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, then it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Returns the property values of a specific font item index.

param.name: exists
param.para: Receives the value TRUE if the font contains the specified property identifier or FALSE if not.

param.name: values
param.para: Receives a pointer to the newly created localized strings object, or nullptr on failure or non-existent property.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.
